page.title: 06Farming in Draycott
page.content:
There are almost 20 farms in the area, the majority are owned by the{Duchy of {Lancaster,}but although tennanted some have been passed down from one generation to the next.
The land which is mainly grassed is used for dairy cattle and some beef cattle, sheep and pigs. Goats are a fairly popular animal for those with smallholdings.
Fields with less heavy soils which are suitable for ploughing are used mainly for varieties of grain or for silage.
Most of the fields are smaller than average, giving an attractive landscape and benefitting the wildlife without hindering the work of the farmers.
